content:
by  Marion RenaultPublished  March  



Ty Moore a Socialist city council candidate was arrested Wednesday for his involvement in protests in downtown Minneapolis PERIOD Police confirmed Monday that Moore was arrested last week for refusing to disburse and interfering with traffic PERIOD He was one of dozens arrested while rallying outside Wells Fargo for greater rights for homeowners PERIOD

The arrests were a form of civil disobedience to draw attention to the emergency that exists in the housing crisis Moore told the Star Tribune PERIOD

The rally of several hundred was organized by Occupy Homes Minnesota and called on Wells Fargo to make put a moratorium on foreclosures and reduce the principals for troubled mortgages according to the Star Tribune PERIOD

The arrests were made around  after the group had been asked by security to leave but continued protesting PERIOD

Moore is currently running for Council Member Gary Schiffs seat in the ninth ward Schiff kicked off his campaign for mayor in late January PERIOD

According to the TC Daily PlanetMoore along with Ward  councilmember Cam Gordon and Minneapolis park commissioner Annie Young was endorsed by the Green Party this month PERIOD

A lot of people and a lot of politicians are worried that socialism is viewed as a dirty word but I wear that label proudly Moore told the Star Tribune PERIOD
